alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western Essex; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A gusty shower will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, north central Henrico, eastern Caroline, northwestern King William, central Hanover and northwestern Essex Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 155 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gusty shower over Glen Allen, or near Randolph Macon College, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ashland around 200 PM EDT. Hanover and Kings Dominion around 205 PM EDT. Dawn and Mangohick around 210 PM EDT. Newtown around 225 PM EDT. Champlain around 235 PM EDT. Loretto around 240 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Beazley, Sparta, Hustle, Hanover Airport, Elevon, Supply, Central Point, Elmont, Longdale and Chance. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with this shower. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This shower may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Western Essex; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William; Western King and Queen
